A legislative amendment that entered into force in DATE introduced the possibility for an accused person to request that his case be brought for trial or terminated if the investigation had not been completed within a time - limit of DATE , depending on the charges ( LAW Code of Criminal Procedure , as in force until DATE ) . That possibility applied with immediate effect in respect of investigations opened before DATE .

CARDINAL . Under the ORG and ORG of DATE ( “ the ORG ” ) individuals can in certain circumstances seek damages for unlawful acts of the authorities . The LAW does not mention excessive length of proceedings as a ground for an action for damages . Nor is there any practice in the domestic courts of awarding damages for excessive length of proceedings .
